result.execSummary:
The defendant Socorro Lopez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Socorro Lopez

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been satisfied.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Socorro Lopez in court with attorney Eryn M Menden.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 5.  Court finds defendant guilty. Cts. 6, 7 and 8 dismissed and read-in. 

Court orders the following: 
Ct. 5:
-  One (1) year jail straight time - 2 days credit -  STAYED for 2 year Probation - may be transferred to Dane County
- Court Costs of $268.00 - apply bail 
- DNA Surcharge of $250.00 - apply bail
- Conditions of  Probation: Follow thru with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent.  Maintain full-time employment and/or combination of schooling.  No contact with Saturno H. or Ronald K..   Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided.
 - Defendant to perform 100 hours of community service in 2 years as a Condition of Probation.
- 30 days jail Condition Time (nonworking hours) STAYED to be used at the Agents discretion. Huber/Straight time to be used at the Agents discretion. 
- Court will permit early termination after 18 months of Probation if successfully completed and at the recommendation of the Agent.

Jury trial - 12 person on June 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Jury status hearing on June 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Character letters filed Melissa D. and Joanna L.
Jury trial - 12 person on June 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Jury status hearing on June 11, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Socorro Lopez in court with attorney Eryn M Menden.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense requests this matter be set for a jury status/jury trial. Court grants request.  Jury status hearing scheduled for June 11, 2015 at 09:30 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for June 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 20, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Socorro Lopez in court with attorney Eryn M Menden.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense needs more time to talk to ADA Galaviz and requests a date in 45 days. Court will set this matter for a plea/sentencing in 45 days.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 20, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant Socorro Lopez in court with attorney Eryn M Menden.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.   Bail remains as fixed.
  Hearing scheduled for March 18, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on February 5, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.

Defendant to have no contact with co defendant, Ronald K. listed in the Criminal Complaint.  Defendant to have no contact with any Sam's Club.   Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant allowed non collect call

Defendant Socorro Lopez in court, in custody, with attorney Eryn M Menden.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Preliminary Hearing requested within 10 days  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 5, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
